metadata.title: CVE-2013-6442 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The owner_set function in smbcacls.c in smbcacls in Samba 4.0.x before4.0.16 and 4.1.x before 4.1.6 removes an ACL during use of a --chown or--chgrp option, which allows remote attackers to bypass intended accessrestrictions in opportunistic circumstances by leveraging an unintendedadministrative change.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-6442` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-winbind - 2:4.1.3+dfsg-2ubuntu4
libpam-smbpass - 2:4.1.3+dfsg-2ubuntu4
libpam-winbind - 2:4.1.3+dfsg-2ubuntu4
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.1.3+dfsg-2ubuntu4
libsmbclient - 2:4.1.3+dfsg-2ubuntu4
libsmbsharemodes0 - 2:4.1.3+dfsg-2ubuntu4
libwbclient0 - 2:4.1.3+dfsg-2ubuntu4
python-samba - 2:4.1.3+dfsg-2ubuntu4
registry-tools - 2:4.1.3+dfsg-2ubuntu4
samba - 2:4.1.3+dfsg-2ubuntu4
samba-common - 2:4.1.3+dfsg-2ubuntu4
samba-common-bin - 2:4.1.3+dfsg-2ubuntu4
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.1.3+dfsg-2ubuntu4
samba-libs - 2:4.1.3+dfsg-2ubuntu4
samba-testsuite - 2:4.1.3+dfsg-2ubuntu4
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.1.3+dfsg-2ubuntu4
smbclient - 2:4.1.3+dfsg-2ubuntu4
winbind - 2:4.1.3+dfsg-2ubuntu4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.1.3+dfsg-2ubuntu4').
